\n<Aoba>Well, do you think he will do a good job?
judge. But if I was being completely

\n<Aoba> Well, I suppose that's to be expected from

\n<Aoba>So, why are you doing this for Prince Louis?
told me to, of course! It doesn’t really

\n<Aoba>No, I mean working for Louis at all.
\n<Gosha>Oh! Well that’s a bit of a long
story, but essentially my family has along
history of working for the royal family,
and in my teenage years I was given the
infantile Prince Louis and essentially act

\n<Aoba>Would you say you two have a close relationship
is obsessed with being friendly with

\n<Aoba>If that is the case, then why is he making you
\n<Gosha>Because he sees no other way to
keep me around! If he was to put me in some
sort of official advisory role, his
\n<Gosha>plummet. After all, I am simply a
commoner, and royalty can’t be seen getting
advice from the common rabble. And on the
other hand, all the advanced tasks that I’m
have you – he has no use of from me
anymore. So, to keep me on the payroll he
assigns me the occasional frivolous task,
plating lunch, and the rest of the time
what I do is up to me.
I wouldn’t change it for the world.
